intro: Pediomelum retrorsum, commonly known as the backward-pointing pediomelum, is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pale yellow or greenish. Its fruit is a dehiscent pod that opens to release seeds, a common reproductive strategy in the legume family. Pediomelum retrorsum is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its drought-resistant properties.
